action.primary: Forcefully breaks up Blood Stasis, regulates Qi and alleviates pain

indications: Blood Stasis with amenorrhea, dysmenorrhea, postpartum abdominal pain and abdominal masses
Food Stagnation and Qi Stagnation with severe abdominal pain and distention

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with bleeding disorders.
Use with caution for those with Deficiency.
interactions: Use with caution for patients taking anticoagulants such as heparin, warfarin (Coumadin) and enoxaparin (Lovenox) or antiplatelet drugs such as aspirin, dipyridamole (Persantine) and clopidogrel (Plavix) as concurrent use may have an additive or synergistic effect.

useCases: Blood Stasis with immobile abdominal masses and postpartum abdominal pain.
Pain due to Food Stagnation with Spleen Deficiency.
Qi and Blood Stagnation with clumping and accumulation leading to pain with distending pain in the chest, epigastrium and abdomen, amenorrhea, dysmenorrhea, uterine myoma and ovarian cysts.
Hepatosplenomegaly with distention, pain and immobile, palpable epigastric, sub-costal and abdominal masses. (only for strong patients)
Abdominal pain, amenorrhea or abdominal masses due to Blood Stasis.
Epigastric and abdominal pain and distention and pain due to Qi Stagnation and indigestion.
Epigastric and abdominal pain from Spleen Deficiency.

notes: This herb is most often used in combination with Rz. Curcumae #{EZhu} E Zhu especially for treatment of cancer.
It has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
It is good to treat severe Qi and Blood Stagnation.
It eliminates old, accumulated, firm masses.
It is primarily used for hypochondriac and abdominal masses.
It is indicated for cardio-diaphragmatic pain.
One source says that this herb reduces vital energy and is always used with Rx. Ginseng #{RenShen} Ren Shen.
This is a stronger Blood Invigoration herb than Rz. Curcumae E Zhu but E Zhu is a stronger Qi mover.

Both San Leng and Hirudo #{ShuiZhi} Shui Zhi break up blood Stasis and enter the Blood level of the Liver channel. San Leng is bitter, neutral and also enters the Spleen and the Qi Level. It is stronger at quickly attacking and breaking up accumulation, but it easily injures normal Qi. It also relieves Food Stagnation.

Dry-fried Sparganium Chao San Leng has its breaking-up quality moderated and its ability to reduce Food Stagnation enhanced. It can be used for epigastric and abdominal distention and pain due to blockage from over-eating.
Wine-fried Sparganium Jiu Chao San Leng has an enhanced ability to move Qi and break up Blood Stasis. It is used for Qi and Blood Stagnation causing abdominal masses and accumulations.
Vinegar Sparganium Cu San Leng has its violent, drying moderated and enters the Liver channel, strengthening its ability to reduce Blood Stasis and stop pain.
